subject: p19182863
History: Evaluation of the patient with pleural effusion, followup.
Findings: Portable AP radiograph of the chest was reviewed in comparison to obtained 3:01 am. There has been interval decrease in the right pleural effusion that could be potentially related to thoracocentesis Post-sternotomy wires are stable as well as cardiomediastinal silhouette and replaced tricuspid valve. Small amount of left pleural effusion is most likely present. Minimal opacity in the left lower lung is noted, might potentially be part of the overall vascular congestion, attention after diuresis is recommended.
